meanings.definition: The act of breaking into small crumbs.
meanings.sent1: I watched the crumbing of the cookie as I bit into it.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the crumbing of the cake as she cut into it.
meanings.sent3: The crumbing of the bread made a mess on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The old book showed signs of crumbing, its pages fragile and worn.
meanings.sent5: The crumbing of the sandcastle left a trail of tiny grains behind.

meanings.definition: The process of coating food with breadcrumbs.
meanings.sent1: The chef's crumbing of the chicken made it crispy and delicious.
meanings.sent2: Mom's crumbing of the fish added a nice crunch to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The crumbing of the fish was so thorough, it looked like a snowy coating.
meanings.sent4: The crumbing of the shrimp was like a golden blanket wrapping each piece.
meanings.sent5: The crumbing of the mozzarella sticks made them irresistible.

meanings.definition: The act of crumbling or falling apart.
meanings.sent1: The old building showed signs of crumbing, with pieces falling off.
meanings.sent2: The cookie's crumbing was a sign of its freshness and softness.
meanings.sent3: The crumbing of the sandcastle was a sad sight after hours of work.
meanings.sent4: The vase's crumbing was inevitable after being knocked off the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The crumbing of the cliff edge was a warning of its instability.
